In this study, photocatalytic activities of BaZrO 3 for CO 2 reduction were investigated in detail.BaZrO 3 samples were successfully obtained via a Pechini process at different temperatures.The prepared samples were characterized by X-ray diffraction (XRD), BET surface area measurement, UV-vis absorption spectroscopy, scanning electron microscopy (SEM) and transmission electron microscopy (TEM).The effects of the deposition of various metal nanoparticles on the surface of BaZrO 3 were also discussed.The

were indispensable for the CO 2 photoreduction process.Fig. 2 also depicts the amount of CH 4 produced from the above photocatalytic system containing different photocatalysts prepared at different temperatures under UV-light irradiation for 8 h.It could be found that the BaZrO 3 samples prepared at different temperatures show similar photoreduction activity.All the BaZrO 3 samples showed relatively low photocatalytic activity, which should be ascribed to the low BET surface and the low efficiency of the

determined by BET measurement (TriStar-3000, Micromeritics, USA) using nitrogen adsorption at 77 K. Transmission electron microscopy (JEOL 3010) was employed to characterize the surface morphologies of BaZrO 3 powder and silver nanoparticles.The gas products were detected using a gas chromatograph with a double-FID (GC-2014, Shimadzu, Japan). The photocatalytic reaction was executed in a cylindrical quartz cell.A plate glass loader filled with the fresh sample (0.1 g) was placed in the cell.The reaction

one was illuminated with the photocatalyst in the absence of CO 2 .All the reactions have been repeated more than five times to confirm the reproducibility and consistency of the photocatalytic experiment.
